task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the goal outline, approach with the circular end-effector, align and execute a few short pushes toward the goal, lightly press to settle, verify goal attainment, then retreat. Control/observation at 10 Hz.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace until it overlaps a fixed, T-shaped goal outline. The sequence begins with perception of the block and goal, followed by a safe approach above the block, orientation alignment of the tool, and multiple short pushes along a diagonal path observed in the frames. After reaching the outline, the robot performs a brief placement press for settling, verifies final position, and retreats to a safe height. Timing is modest, consistent with 10 Hz sensing and control.
preconditions: Block (T_block) and goal outline (target_goal) are visible
No gripper engagement is required (pure push)
stepwise_plan: Scan and detect T_block and target_goal
Move above the block and set pushing yaw
Iterate: align to block edge and push a short distance toward goal
Re-detect and fine-settle at target with a light press
success_criteria: T_block overlaps target_goal within visual tolerance
End-effector ends clear of the block
failure_and_recovery: Misalignment or drift → re-run ApproachAndAlign before next push
Block rotation during push → additional smaller pushes after re-alignment
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when IsAt(target_goal) returns success after settling press; otherwise it continues or fails per node statuses.

frame_3.now_evidence: First solid tool–block contact while aligned to push direction is visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: A forward push along the observed southeast diagonal should follow.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Raster scan to localize the T_block.
Hover above the block at a safe height.
Orient the tool to align with the push direction (diagonal).
Laterally align tip to the block’s push face.
Short push toward the goal; repeated for incremental motion.
Light press to settle the block inside the goal outline.
Check goal attainment (assumed to evaluate block vs. goal).
Back off to clear the workspace.

failure_modes: Goal or block not detected due to glare/occlusion
Block rotates causing misalignment with outline
Push overshoots due to friction variance
Yaw mis-set leading to off-axis motion
recovery_strategy: Reduce push distance by keeping Repeat cycles but smaller steps
Adjust yaw and reattempt push sequence
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target. We trust the frames and name them T_block and target_goal accordingly.
IsAt(target_goal) is assumed to evaluate block pose relative to goal (library does not provide an explicit block-vs-goal comparator).
Diagonal push direction (135°) chosen to match observed motion toward the goal outline.

expected_success_criteria: After Repeat of pushes and a settling press, the block visually overlaps the outline within tolerance
No further correction needed before retreat
